quartz.lib.scheme.proc

Class SafeProcedureN

  • java.lang.Object
    • gnu.mapping.PropertySet
      • gnu.mapping.Procedure
        • gnu.mapping.ProcedureN
          • quartz.lib.scheme.proc.SafeProcedureN
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    gnu.mapping.Named
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultipleNamedProcedureN

    public abstract class SafeProcedureN
extends gnu.mapping.ProcedureN
    If you forget to override Procedure.applyN(Object[]), you'll get a mysterious infinite recursion error which costs you a couple of hours to find out. In order to prevent this error, I will make it an abstract method and ban to use the ProcedureN directly. (Thu, 29 Aug 2019 19:08:52 +0900)
